definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: The villagers whose cottages are destroyed by the floods have to be relocated immediately.
sentences.chinese: 房舍被洪水沖壞的村民必須立即被安置到其他地方。

sentences.english: As the mist cleared, the house came into sight bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 隨着霧散天晴，房舍逐漸呈現在眼前。

sentences.english: Far off the homes of men, and farther still.
sentences.chinese: 一片人家的房舍，還有更遠處。

sentences.english: Nick put them into a little house. Do you know what a rabbit house is called?
sentences.chinese: 尼克把它們放進一個小房舍裏，你知道兔舍叫什麼嗎？

sentences.english: So i wheeled it over to the shed ,still within sight of the house.
sentences.chinese: 於是，我把它推出小棚，仍作爲房舍的一景。

sentences.english: The sun is there, the slender trees, the lemon houses.
sentences.chinese: 太陽就在那兒，細溜兒的樹木，檸檬色的房舍。

sentences.english: The building has been torn down in Hsin-Ying Sugar Factory.
sentences.chinese: 新營糖廠內已遭夷爲平地的房舍。

sentences.english: Houses and furniture are built of wood.
sentences.chinese: 房舍和傢俱是用木頭做的。

sentences.english: Stone barns in the hills above Muker village, Yorkshire Dales, England.
sentences.chinese: 村上方山丘裏用石頭建築的房舍。

sentences.english: Our inheritance is turned to aliens: our houses to strangers.
sentences.chinese: 我們的房舍，歸屬了異邦人。

sentences.english: Her house was elegant and her table dainty.
sentences.chinese: 她的房舍典雅，而且飯菜講究。

definition: (literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
Pingfang district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang
